Detailed Description

Class for accessing GNUBLIN i2c bus.

The GNUBLIN I2C bus can easily accessed with this class

Definition at line 87 of file i2c.cpp.

int gnublin_i2c::open_fd ( )
private

Opens the devicefile. If a file is already open it is closed first. A new file is opened and io operations defined based on the class values for devicefile and slave_address.

Returns
success: 0, failure: -1

Definition at line 149 of file i2c.cpp.

int gnublin_i2c::receive ( unsigned char *  RxBuf,
int  length 
)

receive bytes from the I2C bus.

This function reads "length" number of bytes from the i2c bus and stores them into the "RxBuf". At success the function returns 1, on failure -1.
e.g.
read 2 bytes into buf
receive(buf, 2);

Parameters
RxBufReceive buffer. The read bytes will be stored in it.
lengthAmount of bytes that will be read.
Returns
success: 1, failure: -1

Definition at line 283 of file i2c.cpp.

int gnublin_i2c::receive ( unsigned char  RegisterAddress,
unsigned char *  RxBuf,
int  length 
)

receive bytes from the I2C bus.

This function reads "length" number of bytes from the register "RegisterAddress" and stores them into the "RxBuf". At success the function returns 1, on failure -1.
e.g.
read 2 bytes into buf
receive(buf, 2);

read 3 bytes into buf from a register with the address 0x12
receive(0x12, buf, 3);

Parameters
RegisterAddressAddress of the register you want to read from
RxBufReceive buffer. The read bytes will be stored in it.
lengthAmount of bytes that will be read.
Returns
success: 1, failure: -1

Definition at line 333 of file i2c.cpp.

int gnublin_i2c::send ( unsigned char *  TxBuf,
int  length 
)

send bytes to the I2C bus.

This function sends "length" number of bytes from the "TxBuf" to the i2c bus. At success the function returns 1, on failure -1.
e.g.
send 2 bytes from buf to the I2C bus
send (buf, 2);

Parameters
TxBufTransmit buffer. The bytes you want to send are stored in it.
lengthAmount of bytes that will be send.
Returns
success: 1, failure: -1

Definition at line 378 of file i2c.cpp.

int gnublin_i2c::send ( unsigned char  RegisterAddress,
unsigned char *  TxBuf,
int  length 
)

send bytes to the I2C bus.

This function sends "length" number of bytes from the "TxBuf" to the register "RegisterAddress". At success the function returns 1, on failure -1.
e.g.
send 2 bytes from buf to the I2C bus
send (buf, 2);

send 3 bytes from buf to a register with the address 0x12
send (0x12, buf, 3);

Parameters
RegisterAddressAddress of the register you want to send the bytes to
TxBufTransmit buffer. The bytes you want to send are stored in it.
lengthAmount of bytes that will be send.
Returns
success: 1, failure: -1

Definition at line 428 of file i2c.cpp.

int gnublin_i2c::send ( unsigned char  value)

send a byte to the I2C bus.

This function sends a byte to the i2c bus. At success the function returns 1, on failure -1.
e.g.
send 0xff to the I2C bus
send (0xff);

Parameters
valuebyte that will be send.
Returns
success: 1, failure: -1

With this function you can set the individual I2C Slave-Address.

Parameters
Addressnew I2C slave Address
Returns
failure: -1

int gnublin_i2c::setDevicefile ( std::string  filename)

set i2c the device file. default is "/dev/i2c-1"

This function sets the devicefile you want to access. by default "/dev/i2c-1" is set.

Parameters
filenamepath to the devicefile e.g. "/dev/i2c-0"
Returns
failure: -1
